definition: to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
name of a district in Hebei
name of a district in Hebei
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: We should have our only methods when doing things, and shouldn't imitate others mechanically.
sentences.chinese: 我们做事得有自己的方法，不能邯郸学步。

sentences.english: From this fable comes the idiom Learn to walk in Handan.
sentences.chinese: “邯郸学步”这个成语就是从这则传说而来的。

sentences.english: Its original meaning is to try to learn the Handan people's walking posture.
sentences.chinese: “邯郸学步”这个成语是指在邯郸学习步法。

definition: lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
